Waikato road deaths: Vigil for five dead in State Highway 3 crash, and three others in three weeks https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waikato-road-deaths-vigil-for- Five-dead-in-state-highway-3-crash-and- Three-others-in-tri-weeks/ RYL3Y3QLPRFTJHEHOXCOA5J4XY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waikato-road-deaths-vigil-for- Five-dead-in-state-highway-3-crash-and- Three-others-in-tri-weeks/ RYL3Y3QLPRFTJHEHOXCOA5J4XY/ Cherie HowieVigil is for anyone who needs it - whether they knew those killed, or not, says organiser. Tue, 04 Jun 2024 04:11:50 +0000 Aimee Coleman White organised tonight's vigil for the eight people killed in recent road deaths – either in Waipā District, or involving people from the district – after thinking of the challenges faced by first responders such as her stepfather, who is a police officer. However the vigil, taking place in Te Awamutu a week after five were killed in a crash north of the town, is for all who need a place to remember, and reflect, she says. Photo / Mike Scott

Tue, 04 Jun 2024 03:54:08 +0000 Christopher Luxon is going on his first trip to the Pacific as PM this week. Photo / Jason Dorday
‘Miracle nobody killed’ in late-night Levin boy racer event https://www.nzherald.co.nz/horowhenua-chronicle/news/miracle-nobody-killed-in-late-night-levin-boy-racer-event/6BCSVNPQQVFCBCCX6LGZEUUIII/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/horowhenua-chronicle/news/miracle-nobody-killed-in-late-night-levin-boy-racer-event/6BCSVNPQQVFCBCCX6LGZEUUIII/ Paul WilliamsA resident thought he was watching a tragedy unfold.Tue, 04 Jun 2024 03:44:47 +0000 Levin man Guy Morgan says the shop facades are not built to hold a crowd of people and it is a "miracle" nobody was killed or seriously injured.
